Articles.Content: Will some one point me in a direction that talked about leaving a ship in orbit and then launching another to dock with it.  Just a general direction would be great.

This may help: https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/189763-illustrated-guide-to-docking/

It also contains a link to an illustrated guide to rendez-vous.

This is cool and will help. I have it bookmarked.  How do I get two ships in space to start.  Get the first one up and then what do I do to get the second ship in orbit , make another ship, launch it ????

 

TIA

Larry

Middle of nowhere WY

We need a launch to warm up today

You can fly a ship, then click to return to the space center while leaving the first ship where it is. You can do this many times. Most of us have several missions in progress, some probes sending back data from places, and several hundred items of space debris floating around.

17 minutes ago, Vanamonde said:

You can fly a ship, then click to return to the space center while leaving the first ship where it is. You can do this many times. Most of us have several missions in progress, some probes sending back data from places, and several hundred items of space debris floating around. 

Yep

Not sure how Cygnus is having this problem in the first place; the evil End Flight button was removed back in 0.21.

I guess I wasn't paying attention and figures out I could return to space Center. 

Thanks I'll try to clutter up space now

Larry

On 1/7/2023 at 1:12 PM, Vanamonde said:

~ and several hundred items of space debris floating around. 

Learning from real life problems, I now make it part of the mission that every piece of debris returns itself to Kerbin or slams into Mün.

I'm no litter bug! ...except for the littering part.
